page.title: 13Lea and Holloway Carnival
page.content: Lea and Holloway carnival was revived in 1969. The commities of{the {church, Darby and Joan and Village {Hall}all combined to form a carnival commitee. A procession starts from the Yew Tree Inn at Holloway with decorated floats, fancy dress parade and a band. This year, 1985 Dr. Denis Ward will open the carnival.{The carnival Queen is selected by popular vote, by the older girls at Lea School. There had been a carnival before {The Second World War,}the donations from this then went to the local hospitals. Groups of clubs in the area benifit from the present day carnival. Numerous side-shows are presented, together with childrens races. The winners of the fancy dress are given a cup. The two local pubs compete for a sheild in the 'tug of war'.
